channel.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
channel.description:
Hey everyone I come here fairly often and i dont like to but, when i have to i have to i guess...
I was wondering if any one knows how to locate the images that you use in your yell commands, asin the gold crowns and donator icons, etc because mine have a black background in them and i want them to blend in with the chat area... so if someone could help me that would be GREAT
thanks in advance :D

item.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

[quote=“13lack drag, post:9, topic:405905”]Gawd i hate trolls.

What base?
if its pi here:
<img=0> is donor
<img=1> is mod
<img=2> is admin symbol[/quote]
You also have no idea what a troll is if you think someone was trolling on this topic.

He’s not asking how to display the image, he’s asking how to get the image to not display a black background.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
item.dc:creator: @Darkmist Darkmist
item.description:
@Darkmist wrote:

I did that before i even posted the donor, admin/owner and mod crown all have black in em, I was thinking if there was a way to do a directory check asin make it read straight from c:/CACHENAME/Sprites/player/modicon.png ?? I tryed adding it into the img= but that failed lol

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Double check the sprites that there’s definitely not two different images of the same crown. Also try being playerRights = 1; and see if the silver crown is the same.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
item.dc:creator: @Darkmist Darkmist
item.description:
@Darkmist wrote:

Well i know that the icons are in the sprite folder but they dont have a background… when i speak normally the icons appear fine, but when i yell they have a black background :\ So im unsure on what to do :\

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Images for Yell commands
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Check the cache or sprites folder. I read that the 317 clients recognise a certain pink colour, 0:255:0 I think, and render it invisible. So locate the image and change the black to pink.

If not, you can set the background to invisible yourself via PhotoShop or whatever program you use. I can’t suggest much else really.

Read full topic
